heading: danish software pirates busted
subheading: an alliance of companies including microsoft, ibm, and apple blows the whistle on a ring of danish software pirates advertising illegal wares on the internet.
author: wired news report
text: danish police, working with an alliance of major software companies, busted a ring of danish software pirates wednesday. at a press conference in copenhagen, members of the business software alliance said the ring had sold 125,000 cd-roms containing us$237 million worth of pirated software.danish police said the pirates had advertised and sold the cds online under the labels best of internet, silverado, and vegas.in a statement wednesday, the bsa said the cd manufacturers who printed the illegal cd-roms for the pirates have also been identified. "the business software alliance is conducting further investigations, and plans to pursue legal actions and seek damages against them," the statement said.bsa members include microsoft, adobe, apple computer, compaq, corel corporation, ibm, intel, intuit, lotus development, network associates, novell, sybase, and symantec.
